body:
In Prometheus 2.8-rc0 the runtime page shows '0s' retention.

2.7.1:
![retention](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/291750/54060292-7579ee80-41fc-11e9-9c74-d00667ba333d.png)

2.8-rc0:
![retention2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/291750/54060359-b6720300-41fc-11e9-83bc-fa316efd143f.png)



Bisect:
a3c41f425699565c880fb529af6d58cf0cb254d5 is the first bad commit
commit a3c41f425699565c880fb529af6d58cf0cb254d5
Author: Krasi Georgiev <krasi-georgiev@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Tue Feb 19 13:53:43 2019 +0200

    use the default time retention value only when no size retention is set (#5216)

    fixes https://github.com/prometheus/prometheus/issues/5213

    Now that we have time and size base retention time bases should not have a default value. A default is set only when both - time and size flags are not set.

    This change will not affect current installations that rely on the default time based value, and will avoid confusions when only the size retention is set and it is expected that the default time based setting would be no longer in place.

    Signed-off-by: Krasi Georgiev <kgeorgie@redhat.com>

:040000 040000 e9acc051e5fd1bfc7262fbd60e675f59976ffa3e 35e8966e63113b7bfc3a61432bbdab27d5a006f6 M      cmd
title: retention shown in runtime page set to 0s
